results.title: Getting better
results.creator_credit: Yuri Sokol, Larry Lucas, Michael Le Moignan, Australian Film Commission and Corroboree Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Black futures (A)”.
The life expectancy of Australian First Nations people is decades less than that of white Australians. But things are changing. First Nations people are taking control of their own health care. They are trying to combine the best elements of Western medicine with their own medical science.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yuri Sokol, Larry Lucas, Michael Le Moignan, Australian Film Commission and Corroboree Films

results.title: The Secret country: the first Australians fight back
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: According to John Pilger, “Australia is a secret country with a secret history.” This documentary looks at that history, the history of Australian First Nations peoples from the time of white settlement to the present, and reveals the extent of the cruelty and injustice inflicted upon them. The central issue throughout the film is the differing perspectives on the land and its uses, providing historical background to the present land rights movement and other areas of activism.

results.title: Half a Chance
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash, Film Victoria and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A collection of dramatised case studies of young offenders on probation. Both the probationer and the probation officer talk about the problems and advantages of this type of supervision.

results.title: Understanding is not enough
results.creator_credit: Alison Head, Keith Head, Uniting Church in Australia and Indignata Filmnic
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Uniting Church and the liaison work it is involved in with the First Nations people in Victoria. By interviewing those involved in the liaison work, the film examines the lived experience of some First Nations people in Victoria.

results.title: The Quinkins
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A group of First Nations storytellers combined their talents to create the pictures and sound for this traditional tale of conflict between the Imnims and the Timaras in Dreamtime. Uses the illustrations from the book of the same name by Dick Roughsey and Percy Trezise.

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 12
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Solar village. In the little township of Nguiu, on Bathurst Island a solar power plant run by First Nations people, has been built, which supplies electricity to the settlement of 800 people.

results.title: Wool Fashion Award
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Against a background of beauty spots in Sydney, models display the winning styles in frocks, sportswear and costumes of the first fashion awards presented in Australia in 1956. Credits include: fashion adviser Pat Woodley; accessories by David Jones Ltd; photographed by George Heath; compered by Bob Pollard and edited by Sydney Whiteley.

results.title: Ask an Australian about her household [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the way of life common to an Australian housewife in her household management, and the goods, services and types of housing available - (1970’s point-of-view). Note: young male child nude in shower scene, may not be suitable for public screening. Note: In Italian.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Film Collection: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This short film, originally shot on 9.5mm film, features shots of Wannon Gorge and Nigretta Falls (formerly known as Upper Wannon Falls) in the Grampians, Victoria.
